profile.bio: Certified professional with a Ph.D. in Civil Engineering from the University of Texas at San Antonio (GPA: 4.00/4.00) and a Master's in Construction Management with Distinction from the University of Lagos. I specialize in leveraging Artificial Intelligence and Computer Vision to enhance safety in construction and high-risk industrial environments.
profile.longBio: With PMP certification and extensive experience leading large-scale projects, I bring a unique combination of technical expertise and practical leadership. My background includes project management, structural engineering, and safety engineering, honed through roles spanning over 7+ years. My career is marked by prestigious awards, scholarships, and recognition for excellence in research and practice. As a mentor and educator, I have guided students and professionals while collaborating with leading academics and industry experts.

projects.title: SOFIS System
projects.subtitle: Self-Organizing Fuzzy Inference System
projects.description: Production-ready Python implementation for automated ergonomic risk assessment with uncertainty quantification, adaptive learning, and task specialization.
projects.longDescription: The SOFIS (Self-Organizing Fuzzy Inference System) is a sophisticated AI-powered framework designed to automatically assess ergonomic risks in construction environments. The system combines advanced pose estimation algorithms with adaptive fuzzy logic to provide real-time risk assessment with uncertainty quantification. It features Monte Carlo simulation for robust risk predictions and can specialize for different task types through self-organizing learning mechanisms.
projects.problem: Traditional ergonomic assessment methods are time-consuming, subjective, and require expert knowledge. Construction workers face high ergonomic risks, but manual assessment cannot scale to monitor all workers continuously.
projects.solution: SOFIS automates the entire process using computer vision and AI, providing continuous monitoring, objective assessments, and uncertainty-aware predictions that help prioritize interventions.
impact: 95% accuracy in pose estimation compared to expert assessments
Real-time processing enabling continuous worker monitoring
Reduced assessment time from hours to seconds
Uncertainty quantification helps prioritize high-confidence interventions
features: Adaptive fuzzy inference for risk assessment

projects.title: ECERI Risk Calculator
projects.subtitle: Elevated Construction Ergonomic Risk Index
projects.description: Interactive web-based tool for ergonomic risk evaluation in height-exposed construction tasks, featuring financial impact analysis and real-time risk assessment.
projects.longDescription: The ECERI (Elevated Construction Ergonomic Risk Index) is an enhanced ergonomic assessment tool specifically designed for construction workers performing tasks at height. Building upon the traditional REBA (Rapid Entire Body Assessment) framework, ECERI incorporates height-specific risk factors and financial impact calculations to provide comprehensive risk evaluation and cost-benefit analysis for safety interventions.
projects.problem: Standard ergonomic assessment tools like REBA do not account for the unique risks associated with working at height in construction. Decision-makers lack tools to quantify the financial impact of ergonomic interventions.
projects.solution: ECERI provides a context-aware assessment framework that incorporates height exposure into risk calculations and translates risk scores into financial metrics, enabling data-driven safety investment decisions.
impact: More accurate risk assessment for height-exposed tasks
Used in multiple construction projects for safety planning
Enables proactive intervention before injuries occur
